instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no backlight, that has no liquid contact. It just stoped working. i´ve tried with a working LCD and it has no BL.
The FL7700 is ok and has 8.5V, R77989 has 8.5V, <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> has 8.2V on <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL>, and 3.3V on <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>,  but on <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> i have 0V on <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>.

Can you help me?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: Do you get image and USB activity?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: Yes. I do get image and USB activity.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> must be high, to get backlight.
Try PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If still the same, force pin 3/<TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> to ground and test again.

Check diode mode to ground on both pins of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Be sure XW7720 is good.
Post <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM levels.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>
Pin1 = 0.420V
Pin2 =0.628V

XW7720 is OK

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>  = 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>  = 0V"
Then you cannot expect backlight...

Try full compatible LCD assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
Sorry, i was measuring them without lcd connected.
Here are the correct readings:

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 1.46V
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>  = 2.84V"

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V on <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> but no BL

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 1.46V"
Did you try PRAM reset 2-3 times?

If still the same, remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and run a wire from <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
I´ve done the PRAM 5 times and made the jumper but with no success. No BL.

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>  with jumper = 2.84V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: Any corrosion sign at A5 ball of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: No corrosion at all.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
<DIODE>D7701</DIODE> voltages?
LCD connected, of course...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: 8.55V on both pins

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
"Try full compatible LCD assembly"
???

Keep <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM joined for testing puropse.

Check all return resistors and compare diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
Yes, I´ve tried with a working LCD and no BL.

Can you please specify the return resistors?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: All return resistors are good (0.25 ohm), and diode readings are good (0.625mV)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: I just realize that all the resistors are bad... they show arround 0.25 ohm, but they should be 10.2 ohm, isn't it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: 0 ohm value is correct.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: Do you have any ideas? Should I replace the <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message:
You should replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and be sure to get good solders.
Once removed, check continuity from A5 ball to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight
threads.message: It worked! Thank you very much.
